H0.text: Snow is the natural process responsible for the formation of the Mississippi Delta.

H1.text: Drought is the natural process responsible for the formation of the Mississippi Delta.

H2.text: Deposition is the natural process responsible for the formation of the Mississippi Delta.

H3.text: Weathering is the natural process responsible for the formation of the Mississippi Delta.

A4.text: the Mississippi Delta is part of an alluvial plain, created by regular flooding of the Mississippi and Yazoo rivers over thousands of years

A6.text: Sedimentary rock – Rock formed by the deposition and cementation of particles
